page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AROUND KINGLASSIE
page.content: The landscape of the area is characterised by two{river valleys} which are separated by a{ridge of low} {hills.}The trend of the landscape is from the west to the east. The northern-most of the two valleys contains the{Lochty Burn,}a tributary of the{River Ore,}which flows in the southern-most valley. The{valley } {floors}are relatively flat and average in height about{76 metres}above sea level. The ridge of hills which lies between the two valleys rises up to a height of{138 metres at Ballfield} {Plantation.}The north facing slope of this ridge is gently sloping but the south facing slope overlooking the valley of the River Ore falls away very rapidly in a series of crags which are most marked at Balgreggie and at Auchterderran.
